p: Access to harm reduction in prisons is severely limited worldwide, and there is a grave dearth of data on prisoner health [ 73, 74]. HIV, viral hepatitis and tuberculosis treatment and prevention, including NSPs and OAT, are near universally less accessible in prison that outside [ 13, 74]. As a result, incarceration represents a significant risk factor for blood-borne virus transmission associated with injecting drugs [ 68, 74].
